item.title: Emotes
item.dc:creator: @_O_Wowzers :O Wowzers!
item.description:
@_O_Wowzers wrote:

[quote=“The Dark Abbys, post:16, topic:193840”]Making into an emote command P2 of 2

Ryt lets hope this works Untested

Open your client.java and search for your Case 168:

Now take a look at it, if you need it, just move onto case 169, but for the purposes of this i will use case 168

Now you need to replace your case 168 with this

case 168: { customCommand("skillcape"); } break;

Now when you click the first emote box it should do the skillcape emote of cape your wearing – edit any errors please somebody–[/quote]
you still need to make a command “skillcapes”
and add it’s look to emote tab which is…
find one of your emote tab commands and just change the one with 180 next to it to saying @red@Emote! or whatever
this is the list i have of which emote tab thingy is which case

180);= case 168: 181);= case 169: 185);=case 170: 186);=case 171: 187);=case 172: 177);=case 165: 179);=case 167: 176);=case 166: 182);=case 161: 175);=case 164: 173);=case 163: 178);=case 162:

Read full topic

The main point is both of us are only trying to help

And therefore if he does not understand eitehr method he could try out the other

item.title: Emotes
item.dc:creator: @The_Dark_Abbys The Dark Abbys
item.description:
@The_Dark_Abbys wrote:

Making into an emote command P2 of 2

Ryt lets hope this works Untested

Open your client.java and search for your Case 168:

Now take a look at it, if you need it, just move onto case 169, but for the purposes of this i will use case 168

Now you need to replace your case 168 with this

case 168: { customCommand("skillcape"); } break;

Now when you click the first emote box it should do the skillcape emote of cape your wearing – edit any errors please somebody–

Read full topic

item.title: Emotes
item.dc:creator: @_O_Wowzers :O Wowzers!
item.description:
@_O_Wowzers wrote:

heres an example

public void capeEmote() { if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14139) { //quest stillgfx(332, absY, absX); stillgfx(247, absY, absX); stillgfx(246, absY, absX); stillgfx(111, absY, absX); stillgfx(593, absY, absX); stillgfx(409, absY, absX); stillgfx(498, absY, absX); stillgfx(497, absY, absX); txt4 = "I DID ALL THE QUESTS!"; string4UpdateRequired = true; }

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("capeemote")){ capeEmote(); }

Read full topic

item.title: Emotes
item.dc:creator: @xRedemptionx xRedemptionx
item.description:
@xRedemptionx wrote:

Dude, look for youself! Use the emote tab cases.

if(playerEquipment[playerCape] == bleh) {
startAnimation(bleh);
stillgfx(bleh, absY, absX);
txt4 = “bleh Emote”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}

And so on.

item.title: Emotes
item.dc:creator: @The_Dark_Abbys The Dark Abbys
item.description:
@The_Dark_Abbys wrote:

Starting now,

Right here we go,

Firstly open your client.java

Next search (ctrl + F) for public class client extends Player implements Runnable

Press enter once

Next add in this list These are the emotes in my serv but i didnt make originally

[code]public void capeEmote() {
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14074) { //attack
stillgfx(346, absY, absX);
stillgfx(427, absY, absX);
stillgfx(83, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Attack”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14077) { //strength
stillgfx(482, absY, absX);
stillgfx(481, absY, absX);
stillgfx(246, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Strength.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14080) { //defence
stillgfx(222, absY, absX);
stillgfx(144, absY, absX);
stillgfx(391, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Defence.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14095) { //hitpoints
stillgfx(444, absY, absX);
stillgfx(574, absY, absX);
stillgfx(199, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Hitpoints.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14083) { //ranging
stillgfx(472, absY, absX);
stillgfx(474, absY, absX);
stillgfx(20, absY, absX);
stillgfx(21, absY, absX);
stillgfx(22, absY, absX);
stillgfx(23, absY, absX);
stillgfx(24, absY, absX);
stillgfx(25, absY, absX);
stillgfx(26, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Ranging.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14086) { //prayer
stillgfx(84, absY, absX);
stillgfx(263, absY, absX);
stillgfx(264, absY, absX);
stillgfx(426, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Prayer.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14089) { //magic
stillgfx(409, absY, absX);
stillgfx(498, absY, absX);
stillgfx(497, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Magic.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14128) { //cooking
stillgfx(563, absY +1, absX);
setAnimation(883);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Cooking.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14134) { //wood
stillgfx(187, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Woodcutting.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14110) { //fletch
stillgfx(588, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Fletching.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14125) { //fish
pEmote = 0x2575;
stillgfx(68, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Fishing.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14131) { //firemaking
stillgfx(453, absY, absX);
stillgfx(446, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Firemaking.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14107) { //crafting
stillgfx(239, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Crafting.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14122) { //smithing
stillgfx(436, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Smithing.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14119) { //mining
stillgfx(287, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Mining.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14101) { //herblore
stillgfx(267, absY, absX);
stillgfx(255, absY, absX);
stillgfx(259, absY, absX);
stillgfx(352, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Herblore.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14098) { //agility
stillgfx(422, absY, absX);
stillgfx(60, absY, absX);
stillgfx(62, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Agility.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14104) { //thieving
stillgfx(421, absY, absX);
stillgfx(143, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Thieving.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14113) { //slayer
stillgfx(466, absY, absX);
stillgfx(468, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Slayer.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14137) { //farming
stillgfx(568, absY, absX);
stillgfx(569, absY, absX);
stillgfx(593, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Farming.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14092) { //runecrafting
stillgfx(111, absY, absX);
stillgfx(185, absY, absX);
stillgfx(186, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Runecrafting.”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14235) { //Hunter
stillgfx(332, absY, absX);
stillgfx(247, absY, absX);
stillgfx(246, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Im a Master of Hunter”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14139) { //quest
stillgfx(332, absY, absX);
stillgfx(247, absY, absX);
stillgfx(246, absY, absX);
stillgfx(111, absY, absX);
stillgfx(593, absY, absX);
stillgfx(409, absY, absX);
stillgfx(498, absY, absX);
stillgfx(497, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Oh my fucking god im such a legend!”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}
}

public int skillcapers[] = {15714,15713,14073,14074,14076,14077,14079,14080,14082,14083,14085,14086,14088,14089,14091,14092,14094,14095,14097,14098,14100,14101,14103,14104,14106,14107,14109,14110,14112,14113,14115,14116,14118,14119,14121,14122,14124,14125,14127,14128,14130,14131,14133,14134,14136,14137};[/code]

NOTE The txt4 may not work NOTE

Now you have a working public void capeEmote()

But its now time to convert into a command

So search for if (command

This should take you to your first command

Under the last }

Press enter twice and C&P this in

if (command.startsWith("skillcape")) { capeEmote(); }

You now have a working Command to do your cape emote, so when you type ::skillcape and your wearing lets say strength cape, it will do strength cape emote and these emotes will differ per cape

If you would like me to try help you convert it into emote tab please say, and ill work on it

Good Luck and Best of Wishes
—The Dark Abbys—

NOTE Omfg i wrote this fast lol, my hand hurts NOTE

Read full topic
